comment: Good lecturer & All I can say is I wish the History Dept would assign him more courses to teach such as 2111!
I would not take this class if you are not a big studier. Those fill in the blank tests with no word bank could ruin you. The lectures are very interesting though. He is a good speaker.

His class is amazing. You can't help but learn materials in the class. The tests are all fill in the blank, no word bank or anything, so you really do have to study and come to class to take note.You HAVE to read the documents in order to pass the tests,but it's not really hard. You also have to go to a museum and write a 5 page paper. Easy peasy(:
Brubaker is cool,however all test are fill in the blank.Also, you will have to visit the Atlanta History Center for an extra 15 bucks.The history center sucks!!!!

GREAT PROFESSOR! I had no interest in history until I took his class. He gets so excited with his teaching that you can't help but get excited, too. Tests are fill in the blank but super easy. No dates to remember. likes lists and names. read the readings in book, just be able to recognize which reading by key words. I would take his class again.

He is cool, but as he stated the first day of class--in his class you will learn history.  Tests are hard though, all fill in the blank crap, and you need to do a bit of reading the book to be able to recognize the sentences on the test and provide with the title of the reading.  Class not mandatory but you need to be there or you'll miss a lot

He is pretty good, finishes lectures early a lot, lectures are ineresting but tests are fill-in the blanks, likes the name, everything from the notes.However, he was messing us up with the readings, often including the articles from the list that was supposed to be for different test, on final he used many of those he didn't use in midterms.
He makes his class very interesting!

Great prof. I bombed the first test, I should have reviewed my notes more, but after that it was smooth. Everything on the test is in your notes. His teaching style will make you learn the material,not a bad thing.The previous posts seem about right. I would take him again. Two thumbs up!

Most of the ratings are true. He is very passionate and knowledgeable. He knows history and wants you to know it too. Review your notes after every class and that will help prepare for the tests.Take good notes and ask as many questions as needed to understand.

Tests are incredibly detailed, but follow his notes almost exactly and he specifically puts emphasis on parts of his lecture he'll test over. He absolutely knows his stuff and is a really funny guy. Doing well in the class definitely takes effort, but it was the best history class I've had thus far at KSU.

Starting to wonder if I had another instructor. I thought we were at school to learn and not understand the game playing that goes on. A textbook with historical errors, grammatical errors and a complete waste of money-included is an instructor who lays on some many dates on you in one class and then expects you to fill in the blanks on a test?

Brubaker Rocks! The tests are all fill in the blank,you definitely have to study but all the material on the tests are topics he has gone over. Don't miss class. You'll miss alot. He makes history very interesting and is extremely passionate about it. You have to go to Atlanta History Center for a 5 page paper. It was a cool assignment.

TEST ARE ALL FILL IN THE BLANK. And you have to be in class everyday so you dont miss anything. This guy can be tricky but is pretty cool, and makes history interesting to learn. for the paper you have to goto the Atlanta History Museum.

He is a pretty nice guy and loves history, but I felt his tests were extremly hard. I would not recommend taking him unless you feel like studying ALOT! Test fill in the blank and it is over a lot of information, too much indeed! He was very impatient and sometimes rude when you asked a question. Had to go to the History museum $15.

A very talented lecturer, but his tests are very precise... took bombing the first one to figure that one out. You MUST attend class every day and you MUST write down everything he says. Ask him to send you the slides.

GREAT professor! This is the first A i've ever got in college. I went to class every day, you HAVE to write down EVERYTHING he says. Its all verbatum on the test. extra credit is given and his last test has new info, but he copy and pastes the exact questions from test 1 and 2 onto test 3. the readings are the only hard part. 5 page paper is easy.

AWESOME PROFESSOR. Prof Brubaker is very knowledgeable on the topics he teaches.He keeps your attention for the entire class whether you a history buff or absolutley hate it. attend class, take good notes and study and you'll definitely get an A in this class.

Very interesting guy and has a passion for history.  He just lectures to slides but he makes it interesting.  The tests are all fill in the blank.  However, if you go to class and take notes his tests are pretty easy.  Would recommend.

I hate history! I think it?s a useless class; however Mr. Brubaker makes it interesting. If you take notes, you?ll do fine. Attendance is not mandatory! But if you miss class you?ll miss a lot of material that?s on the test.

I LOVED this class! If you absolutely hate history I would not recommend taking this class but if you are willing to go to class everyday, take good notes, and study for the tests you can easily make an A. The tests are fill in the blank no word bank but he gives a 30 pt extra credit assignment.

Not certain what motivated previous comments-lectures are 50% inaccurate-material for important times glanced over, reluctance to cover current events instead choosing to choose opinions over facts-very disappointing

He was definitely the best history teacher that I have had - at two different schools in two degree programs.  I had him in 2001 - so it was a while ago.  Take EXCELLENT notes and study them - you will do fine!  He's extremely funny, as well.  It was tough - but we're in college to learn, right?
Excellent professer! His tests are all fill-in-the-blank so take good notes! Don't worry too much about the History Center paper: MAKE HIM LAUGH and you'll get an A.

AWESOME professor! The class was definitely challenging, but worth every second. His lectures always kept my interest, even if I had no prior interest in the topic. Attend class and take good notes in order to do well on his fill in the blank tests. 5 page critique on the Atlanta History Center is required. Extra credit is offered, if needed.
Go to class and take good notes.  If you do this, you will do well on his tests.  Seriously, EVERYTHING he says is on the test.  Very passionate about what he teaches, overall a good teacher.

Mr. Brubaker was a wonderful and intriguing teacher.  He is very passionate about the subject which in turn makes you passionate about history.  2 tests and then the final which is comprehensive and a 5 page paper about Atlanta History Musuem.  Great guy but sometimes I caught him staring at my butt.  That was very strange.

Take his class!  Hands down the best teacher I have had in my 3 years at KSU.  He makes learning fun.  Take down every note you can, and memorize all of them for the test, fill-in-the-blank.  You will Ace the tests if you study.
The best feeling when you walk into a classroom and your are excited. He makes you excited. You can tell he knows his history and is passionate about history. His teaching is passionate.

His test are madness!!! 50 fill in the blank questions. He considers mutilpal choice test for stupid people. If you're not in class everyday you will have a hard time. I was there everyday took lots of notes and recorded the class and still struggled. His motto "know everything and you pass".

If you attend class, you will do well.  What he says in class will be on the tests.  He made us read a ton of documents, also on the tests.  Bottom line:  pay attention, you'll learn and you'll smoke the tests.  Skip class and you're screwed.  Good, lively lectures, but some flavored with some oddball politics.  Overall, a good laugh and good class

GARBAGE. Sometimes lectures on useless material that isn't on the test. Made mistakes on every test and is very stubbon about correcting them. I made A's on all tests and the paper, but made a C on the quiz. Somehow ended up a B. Refused to me my exact grade on the final so i can't determine how i didn't get an A. Others in my class had same probs.

Brubaker is one of the best professors I have had so far- very enthusiastic and easy going. You WILL need to attend class(need to-not required). You WILL get a hand cramp from note taking. Tests are tough- fill in the blank. This is not an easy A class, but it CAN be done with hard work. If you want to learn and have fun, take his class.

Fabulous teacher!  He is very passionate about his subject and it shows!  His lectures are informative and entertaining.  And, guess what? His tests are hard, you have to go to class, take good notes, and learn the material to get good grades ----- wow, what a concept!!
Beware! Beware! If you care about keeping your good GPA, DON'T take this class! Very difficult tests, obscure questions, NO textbook, and must depend on his "rapid fire" lectures for course material.

Brubaker is an entertaining and engaging professor.  What others say about his tests are true.  You have to go to class and you have to pay attention.  Brubaker truly loves history and it shows.  His thought provoking, informative storytelling style makes history easy to digest for those who aren't fond of it.  I would take any of his classes.

Tests were difficult because they are fill in the blank.  The final is comprehensive.  He is a very good teacher though.  He explains the information in a way that it is easy to understand and learn.  If you don't go every class & take really good notes, you won't do well.

Good teacher, go to class you'll be fine.All tests are fill in the blank, but he gives you the answers in his powerpoints.Know names, Vocabulary, and readings and you will ace the test.He doesnt care about dates, well only one 1877, that's it!  One paper to write, and the paper is opinion based on the Atlanta History museum.  Definitly take him
The best History prof; bar none. Definitely take him if you have the chance. Excellent lecturer. Very passionate about the subject. Go to class, pay attention, and take good notes...you will do fine.
best history teacher ever!!! fun and excited about what he does. makes you enjoy history. i would highly recommend taking this class. Just take good notes!!!
His stories are the best. They helped me remember everything for the tests.
One of my favorite history teachers.  I enjoyed the class alot.  As long as you take notes in class and pay attention you'll do fairly well in his class.
Professor Brubaker is AWESOME. He's SOOOO excited about what he is teaching - its fun to be in his class because he's just so happy!
Take very good notes because his tests come straight from them. Fun lectures and great information.
If you take notes and read over them you will do fine. His exams comes straight from his notes!
enthusiastic teacher that makes history fun to learn. bring extra lead cause you'll take a lot of notes. great teacher.

Wow, what a great teacher.  I took him for summer semester - he managed to keep my interest for the entire 3 hours.  His quizzes were fair, you had to study, but you'd get the grade you deserved.  Definitely take his class!!!!

Great teacher, don't take any other professor for this class...my friends took different teachers and class were hard but with Prof. Brubaker you actually love the class and learn, and do well...TAKE HIM!

Excellent teacher. First time I really got interested in US History, he keep you awake and most of all you actually learn something!  Only one paper to write and due at the end of semester.  Quiz are easy and the reading assignments are good.  Don't take other teacher...specially if you need an A.
He's the best professor i've had at KSU so far. He's extremely clear and makes history interesting and fun.

Excellent professor.  You have to visit the museum and write a summmary but he gives good grades for it.  He lets you know exactly what to expect.  He appears hard on the first day but trust me, he's easy.  You will enjoy this class.  He is very energetic.  Outstanding professor!

Best history teacher I've ever had.  For the first time I can say I actually learned something in a history class instead of falling asleep like in past classes.  You have to take a lot of notes, but it really makes you learn the material.  He is one of the best at KSU.

There are four tests, one final, 5 quizes, pop quizes, and a min.5 page writing assignment about the Atlanta History Center in which he suggests you have to spend a minimum of 5 hours. He jokes in class and is willing to help.

Very knowledgeable about the subject.  Not the most animated teaching style but not boring.  Tests are easy fill-in the blank.  My only problem is that he requires you to visit the Atlanta History Center, where he works, which hints at inpropriety.
Very easy and fun class!!
Very good teacher. He gives a lot of notes in class so you can't skip.
Very interesting, and funny...easy exams!!
He is a very animated teacher!  Everyone should get an A or a B.  His tests are easy(you have to read the selections he gives you).  He is the BEST HISTORY professor at KSU
Great teacher  Enthusiastic and fair
You can easily get an A or B if you attend and take good notes.
